description.narrative:
Ambassaden planerar garantistöd till Private Agriculture Sector Support (PASS) om 20 MUSD med en subvention om 13 MSEK.
Då PASS nuvarande strategi löper ut under 2017 har de initierat arbetet med att utveckla en ny strategi. Ett första steg togs av den nuvarande finansiären Danida i slutet av 2016 genom en utvärdering.
Ambassaden ser anledning till att stödja PASS i denna utvecklingsprocess. Dels för att PASS har uttryckt behov och efterfrågat stöd inom ffa jämställdhet, miljö och resultarbete och dels för att ambassaden ser det som villkor för det föreliggande garantistödet vilket förväntas bidra till ökad riskreducering och förbättrade resultat.
Ambassaden beslutade 2017-09-11 om att inleda upphandling (Beslut 55/2017) Insatsen består av olika uppdrag för att stödja PASS samt den ovannämnda beredningen.
Detta beslut om tilldelning av kontrakt gäller för konsulttjänst för stöd till PASS strategiutveckling.
Direkt upphandling genomfördes av ambassaden lokalt för att säkerställa teknisk och lokal expertis.
Följande konsultfirmor kontaktades: Klim, EnviClim Net, COWI, Oxford Policy Management (OPM), Carnegie Consult och Center for Business Excellence (CBE).
Ambassaden mottog 3 anbud från Klim, CBE och Carnegie.
Konsultföretaget Klim ansågs vara det mest fördelaktiga av upphandlingskommittéen, både tekniskt och ekonomiskt. Klim har lång erfarenhet från arbete med PASS i Tanzania samt liknande organisationer från andra lander, jordbruksfinansiering generellt samt strategi och programutveckling. Klim låg dessutom långt under övriga anbud gällande pris. Kommittéen bestod av Nicomed Bohay från PASS, Jema Ngwale från Danida samt Sara Spånt, Sveriges Ambassad.
Utöver detta kommer även Sidas helpdeskar för miljö och klimat samt jämställdhet att utnyttjas.

Collected support to the development of PASS' new five-year Strategy (2018-2022), including consultancy support for gender, environment and climate change, and results based management (RBM).
The Embassy is planning a guarantee support to Private Agriculture Sector Support (PASS) on 20 MUSD with a subsidy of 13 MSEK.
As PASS current strategy ends in 2017, PASS has initated work on developing a new strategy.
The Embassy aims to support this process. Partly as PASS has expressed need for support. Partly as the Embassy views the support as part of risk mitigation and as contributing to increased impact/results.
Overall contribution consist of different assignments to support PASS strategy development as well as the ongoing appraisal process at the Embassy.
The embassy decided on 2017-09-11 to begin procurement for strategy support (Decision 55/2017). This decision is regarding allocation of contract for consultancy support to PASS strategy development.
A direct procurement has been completed for support to PASS strategy development to ensure the specific expertise required.
Following consulting firms have been contacted: Klim, EnviClim Net, COWI, Oxford Policy Management (OPM), Carnegie Consult and Center for Business Excellence (CBE).
The Embassy received 3 proposals from consulting firms: Klim, CBE and Carnegie.
Klim was regarded as the most advantageous proposal by the tender committee, both technically and economically. Klim has long experiences from working with PASS in Tanzania as well as from other similar organisations in other countries, agricultural financing and program and strategy development. Klim's price was also far below the others.
The tender committee consisted by Nicomed Bohay from PASS, Jema Ngwale from Danida and Sara Spånt, Sveriges Ambassad.

This is a contribution for based on Internal Decision 20/2017 to provide Technical Assistance support for PASS strategy development, including environment, gender and organizational development. Planit: 11076 PASS stöd till strategiutveckling/PASS support to strategy development. It was aimed to provide Technical Assistance support for PASS strategy development, including environment, gender, and organizational development. It has Two Components: - 11076A0101 PASS strategy development support - 11076A0102 PASS strategy, environment and gender support Total amount: 2 000 000 It bases on the guarantee agreement and hence it is linked to the main guarantee contribution 10154-Private Agriculture Sector Support (PASS) The conclusion of performance covers the year 2019 and 2020. There is a separate conclusion on performance for the guarantee contribution

tag.narrative: 2.3 - By 2030, double the agricultural productivity and incomes of small-scale food producers, in particular women, indigenous peoples, family farmers, pastoralists and fishers, including through secure and equal access to land, other productive resources and inputs, knowledge, financial services, markets and opportunities for value addition and non-farm employment.

2.3 - Till 2030 fördubbla jordbrukets produktivitet och inkomster för småskaliga livsmedelsproducenter, i synnerhet kvinnor, ursprungsfolk, familjejordbrukare, boskapsskötande nomader samt fiskare, inklusive genom säker och lika tillgång till mark, andra produktionsresurser och insatsvaror, kunskap, finansiella tjänster och marknader samt möjligheter till värdeskapande och sysselsättning utanför jordbruket.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Funds were set aside during appraisal process to support PASS environmental and gender strengthening as well as the development of the new strategy for 2018-2022. Support for environment and gender has so far been given through collaboration with the respective helpdesks and therefore no funds used for this. As a result, a gender assessment and a simplified environmental assessment were both completed in 2017 and recommendations were included in the new PASS Strategy for 2018-2022. In 2017, a consultant KLIM was recruited by the embassy in collaboration with PASS and DANIDA to facilitate the strategy development process together with PASS. The assignment was successfully delivered in January 2018 and payment has been done.
The objectives have already been achieved and the Embassy though decision number 03/2020, amended the Internal Decision No 20/2017 and the guarantee agreement 2017-2024 to provide the possibility for further organizational support including the implementation of the recommendations on gender and environment. As result of Swedish complimentary guarantee, PASS has been overwhelmed in reporting because of big data of loans and beneficiaries. PASS requested the reallocation of 1 000 000 kr from this contribution to contribute the cost of infrastructure for digitalization. Significant part of funding comes from DANIDA
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
